attributes.TECHNICAL_DESCR:
H2V Thionville is a 400 MW electrolyser, located in the industrial area of Thionville in France, close to the German and Luxembourg borders.

The estimated total production capacity of the project is of 0.056 Mt/y of hydrogen.

The production of hydrogen will be dedicated to industrial and mobility applications.

The hydrogen will be produced with electricity coming from wind and solar power purchase agreements (PPA) and grid electricity from the French mix.

The plant will be connected to RTE gas grid: project mosaHYc (moselle-saar-hydrogen-conversion), developed by the distribution network operators Creos (Germany) and GRTgaz (France), in cooperation with the energy company Encevo (Luxembourg).

The project will be developed in two phases:  

  • the first 200 MW are planned to operate by 2028.  
  • the second phase of 200 MW capacity is aimed to be operational by 2030.
